'speaker_9': 'Thank you. I'm really excited about this resolution. I know it's item number 19 on a long agenda, on a long day. But I want to just highlight that this is a bold commitment on how we address climate change in our transportation fleet.'

'speaker_9': 'In this initiative, which he announced last spring, it's a commitment to invest in charging stations to green the city of Seattle's fleet, the ones we use for city workers also working with non non-vehicle machines like forklifts and cranes to get those on electricity.'

'speaker_9': 'The second thing it does is adopts the have the oil initiative, an initiative initiated by the Union of Concerned Scientists. It's a commitment to reduce our oil consumption by 50% by the year 2035. And the third thing I want to highlight it does is it sets the goal for the city of Seattle, not for the city as'

'speaker_9': 'an entity, but everyone in the city. That half of the private registered vehicles in the city sorry, 30% of the registered vehicles in the city would be electric by the year 20, 30, 30% by 2030. And that would be a huge I've taken commitment to electric vehicles.'
